metadata.title: Convert Kelvin to Celsius – Temperature Converter
metadata.description: Convert temperature from Kelvin (K) to Celsius (°C), useful for interpreting scientific temperatures in everyday units.

introduction: This converter transforms temperature from Kelvin to Celsius, enabling practical interpretation of scientific temperatures.
Kelvin is used in science but Celsius is familiar for everyday understanding.
This converter uses the relationship where °C = K - 273.15.
methodology: To convert Kelvin to Celsius: °C = K - 273.15. For example, 273.15 K = 0°C, 298.15 K = 25°C.
Scientific results expressed in Kelvin need conversion to Celsius for practical understanding.
Understanding conversion between Kelvin and Celsius is essential for physics and chemistry contexts.
This converter provides precise temperature conversions.

faqs.question: What is the conversion from Kelvin to Celsius?
faqs.answer: °C = K - 273.15. Subtract 273.15 from kelvin to get celsius.

faqs.question: Why is Kelvin used in science?
faqs.answer: Kelvin is absolute temperature scale, essential for physics equations and ratios.

faqs.question: What temperature is room temperature in Kelvin?

glossary.definition: SI base unit of temperature, absolute scale starting at absolute zero.
Temperature scale where water freezes at 0° and boils at 100°.
